title: Eight shot in overnight melee
content:
An overnight shooting in west Shreveport left eight people with wounds that required transport to University Health and Willis-Knighton Medical Center, police say.
It happened right around 2:30 a.m. Sunday in the 3500 block of Hearne Avenue, where Shreveport police patrol officers responded to a shooting call and found one victim, 19-year-old Nicholas Jiles, in the parking lot of a service station in the 3700 block of Hearne. Jiles suffered a gunshot wound to a leg along with a grazing wound to his back. He was taken by ambulance to University Health for treatment and is expected to recover.
Officers on the scene learned that seven other victims, including a 16-year-old girl, had been taken by private vehicles to Willis-Knighton Medical Center on Greenwood Road and to University Health with wounds ranging from minor to potentially life-threatening, according to a release.
In addition to Jiles and the 16-year-old girl, whose name was not released by police, victims were Tramarceia Ruffins, 22; Mary Davis, Trevonte Carter and Shontae Armstrong, ages not available; Gerod Ward, 18; and Oshaye Collins, 21.
Investigators say early information indicates two groups of people were loitering on adjacent parking lots at the intersection of Hearne Avenue at Kings Highway and that at some point gunfire was exchanged, resulting in the injuries.
Police recovered a handgun as well as dozens of spent shell casings. A vehicle and a business were among property damaged as a result of the gunfire, the report added.
No one has yet been arrested in connection with the shooting, police said. People with information on the shooters or the incident should call investigators at (318) 673-6955 or Shreveport Crime Stoppers at (318) 673-7373.
